thread.title: Four injured in London tour bus accident
thread.title_full: Four injured in London tour bus accident

title: Four injured in London tour bus accident
text:
Four people were left injured yesterday after the roof of a double-decker bus was ripped off in central London, when it collided with a tree branch. 
London Fire Brigade was called following the accident, which was reported to be non-life threatening”. 
Roads surrounding the site nearby Tavistock Square were closed. 
One passenger described the scene as “chaos” and said there was “blood all over the floor”. 
London’s Air Ambulance also attended the incident. 
The bus company, which is operated by Golden Tours, runs tours around London and locations such as Bath and Stonehenge.
